abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>Although over 50 genes are known to cause renal malformation if mutated, the underlying genetic basis, most easily identified in syndromic cases, remains unsolved in most patients. In search of novel causative genes, whole-exome sequencing in a patient with renal, i.e., crossed fused renal ectopia, and extrarenal, i.e., skeletal, eye, and ear, malformations yielded a rare heterozygous variant in the <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> gene encoding growth differentiation factor 6, a member of the BMP family of ligands. Previously, <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> variants were reported to cause pleiotropic defects including skeletal, e.g., vertebral, carpal, tarsal fusions, and ocular, e.g., microphthalmia and coloboma, phenotypes. To assess the role of <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> in the pathogenesis of renal malformation, we performed targeted sequencing in 193 further patients identifying rare <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> variants in two cases with kidney hypodysplasia and extrarenal manifestations. During development, <jats:italic>gdf6</jats:italic> was expressed in the pronephric tubule of <jats:italic>Xenopus laevis</jats:italic>, and <jats:italic>Gdf6</jats:italic> expression was observed in the ureteric tree of the murine kidney by RNA in situ hybridization. CRISPR/Cas9-derived knockout of <jats:italic>Gdf6</jats:italic> attenuated migration of murine IMCD3 cells, an effect rescued by expression of wild-type but not mutant <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic>, indicating affected variant function regarding a fundamental developmental process. Knockdown of <jats:italic>gdf6</jats:italic> in <jats:italic>Xenopus laevis</jats:italic> resulted in impaired pronephros development. Altogether, we identified rare heterozygous <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> variants in 1.6% of all renal anomaly patients and 5.4% of renal anomaly patients additionally manifesting skeletal, ocular, or auricular abnormalities, adding renal hypodysplasia and fusion to the phenotype spectrum of <jats:italic>GDF6</jats:italic> variant carriers and suggesting an involvement of GDF6 in nephrogenesis.</jats:p>

assertion.value: The authors declare that they have no conflict of interest.
